required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Characteristics of Patients With Hypersensitivity Reactions to Intravenous Iron Infusions
clinical_study.official_title: Characteristics of Patients With Hypersensitivity Reactions to Intravenous Iron Infusions - a Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate characteristics of patients with previous hypersensitivity reaction grades I-IV to intravenous ferric carboxymaltose (Ferinject) or to iron sucrose (Venofer) including age, atopy status, previous allergic reactions, previous medical history, current medications and co-morbidities. Furthermore, symptoms on reaction such as severity grade of reaction will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Patients with HSRs to NDIPs that were treated at the University Hospital Basel between the 16th of January 2018 and the 24th of October 2019
primary_outcome.description: Data collection (medical history) will be performed from patient records stored in the protected electronic patient system ISMed (Integrated System for Medical Diagnostic) of patients with HSRs to NDIPs

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Patients with HSRs to NDIPs that were treated at the University Hospital Basel between the 16th of January 2018 and the 24th of October 2019
primary_outcome.description: Data collection (Family history) will be performed from patient records stored in the protected electronic patient system ISMed (Integrated System for Medical Diagnostic) of patients with HSRs to NDIPs

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Patients with HSRs to NDIPs that were treated at the University Hospital Basel between the 16th of January 2018 and the 24th of October 2019
primary_outcome.description: assessment of hypersensitivity reactions (grade I-IV) to Ferinject or Venofer

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Patients with HSRs to NDIPs that were treated at the University Hospital Basel between the 16th of January 2018 and the 24th of October 2019
primary_outcome.description: which preparation was used for Treatment ( iron sucrose (Venofer) or ferric carboxymaltose (Ferinject)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Patients with HSRs to NDIPs that were treated at the University Hospital Basel between the 16th of January 2018 and the 24th of October 2019

arm_group.arm_group_label: patients with hypersensitivity reactions to NDIPs
arm_group.description: Patients with previous hypersensitivity reaction grades I-IV to intravenous ferric carboxymaltose (Ferinject) or to iron sucrose (Venofer)

intervention.description: Data collection (history, clinical presentation, medication, complications, laboratory testing) will be performed from patient records stored in the protected electronic patient system ISMed (Integrated System for Medical Diagnostic) of patients with HSRs to NDIPs.
intervention.arm_group_label: patients with hypersensitivity reactions to NDIPs

study_pop.textblock: Participants from 16 years of age and older with previous hypersensitivity reaction grades I-IV to intravenous ferric carboxymaltose (Ferinject) or to iron sucrose (Venofer).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants from 16 years of age and older with previous hypersensitivity reaction grades I-IV to intravenous ferric carboxymaltose (Ferinject) or to iron sucrose (Venofer).
Exclusion Criteria:
- No previous hypersensitivity reaction to iron preparations or reactions to oral iron preparations.
- If a rejection to use patient data is documented in patient records, the patient will be excluded from analysis.
